metadata.ground_truth: Alexander Bed and Brrakfast is located outside of town, whereas El Shaddai is in a centeral location and within walking distance of a lot of things.
metadata.predicted: The Alexander Bed and Breakfast is in a quiet suburb and El Shaddai is located in a good part of town.

conversation.content: I really would like to try a japanese restaurant while in Cambridge.
Wagamama is a Japanese restaurant on 36 Saint Andres Street. Would you like me to make a reservation for you?
I'd like to treat myself.  Is this in the expensive range?
It is expensive. Shall I book it for you?
Yes, if this restaurant is in the Centre. I also need the postcode and phone number please.
Of course. The phone is 01223462354 and the post code is cb23ar. Can I do anything else for you?
I also need a hotel in the cheap price range.
I have located 2 hotel options, Alexander Bed and Breakfast and El Shaddai, both have internet and parking available. Would you like me to book one of these for you?
Are these located in a good part of town?
The Alexander Bed and Breakfast is in a quiet suburb and El Shaddai is located in a good part of town.

Like I said before, a quiet suburb isn’t what I want—I need a place in a good part of town with easy access to the centre. That won’t work if it’s far from the centre or the restaurant; how far are these from the centre and from Wagamama on Saint Andrews Street? And what’s the parking situation at each?
El Shaddai is in the city centre. It has free parking. Would you like me to book it for you?

That won’t work without exact distances—“city centre” is too vague. I need the walking times to the centre and to Wagamama on Saint Andrews Street, not just a generic claim.

Also confirm the parking and proximity details for Alexander Bed and Breakfast, since you mentioned both—free parking isn’t enough if it’s nowhere near the action. <END> bye
